'''Hendor''' was a servant of [[Idril]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.

==History==
He was a [[:Wikipedia:Housecarl|house-carl]] of [[Idril]] in [[Gondolin]], and was aged.<ref>{{LT2|IIIn}}, ''Entries in the Name-list to The Fall of Gondolin'', p. 216</ref> When the [[Fall of Gondolin]] began, Idril sent most men of her guard down the [[Idril's secret way|secret way]] with young [[Eärendel]].<ref name=Gondolin>{{LT2|III}}</ref>{{rp|187}} Hendor had to carry the child down the tunnel, and while crossing [[Tumladin]] these men were persecuted by [[Orcs]] upon [[wolves]]. However, they were saved by [[Tuor]] and Hendor was relieved of his burden, although Eärendel claimed he did not need to be beared.<ref name=Gondolin/>{{rp|190}}

==Etymology==
''Hendor'' is never glossed, but it could be related with [[Gnomish]]/[[Qenya]] ''[[hen]]'' ("eye").<ref>{{PE|15}}, p. 27</ref>
